_header: Saint Oswald the holy king of the one end of England
Subjects: saints’ lives; Oswald, king, life of
_description: Life of St. Oswald the King in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEynt Oswold þe holi kyng of þe on ende of engelondeKyng
                    was as vel þulke tyme of norþhomblonde…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…Nou seynt oswold þe martir so our ernde bedeþat god
                    ous sende is swete help & alle þat halbe nede

Bod779.First Lines:
Seynt oswold þe gode kyng of þe on ende of ingelondeKyng
                    was as fel þulke tyme In norþ homberlonde…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…Now seynt oswold þe martyre oure erande so bedeÞat
                    oure lord sende helpe to alle þat habbeþ nede

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint Oswold þe goode kyng of þat on ende of
                    EngelondeKyng was as fel þulke tyme of al
                    Northhumberlonde…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Now seint Oswold þe Martir vr erende so beodeÞat vr
                    lord vs sende his swete help and alle þat habbeþ neode.
                    Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
SEint Oswold þe holie king of þe on ende of
                    enguelondeKing was ase þulke tyme bi feol in northy
                    homberlonde…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…Þat he us for ȝiue ore sunnes and us helpe at alle ore
                    neodeAnd ore soule for is swete loue in to blisse lede
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 45-6.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint Oswold þe gode king of þe on ende of EngelondKing
                    was som tyme In Northomberlonde…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Nou Seint oswold þe martir oure erande so beodeþat
                    oure lord vs sende help & all þat haue neode
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

CULAdd2585.First Lines:
…As por al þe helpe as seint Oswalde to good alwey þat [
                    ] weCristendome into Ingelonde cam þan faste ynowSeynt Oswolde
                    [made] þis holy man a byschop in þis landeHee was gos god
                    counseylor & þin[ ]d cristes sonde…
CULAdd2585.Last Lines:
…Now saint Oswolde þe holy kynge aer erand to þu
                    ledeÞat oure lorde send his helpe at oure most need

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Seint oswold þe holy king of þe on ende of engelondeKyng
                    was as uel þulke tyme of al norþhomberlond…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Nou seint oswold þe martir oure erende so beodeþat
                    oure louerd us sende is swete help & alle þat habbeþ
                    neode

D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145

Seint Oswald þe holy kyng of þe on ende of EngelondeKyng

SEint oswolde þe holy king of þe on ende of engelondeking

BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…Nou seint oswolde þe martir oure erande so bedeþat
